<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_shmem_try_map:
```c
static int metal_shmem_try_map(struct metal_page_size *ps, int fd, size_t size,
			       struct metal_io_region **result)
{
	size_t pages, page, phys_size;
	struct metal_io_region *io;
	metal_phys_addr_t *phys;
	uint8_t *virt;
	void *mem;
	int error;

	size = metal_align_up(size, ps->page_size);
	pages = size / ps->page_size;

	error = metal_map(fd, 0, size, 1, ps->mmap_flags, &mem);
	if (error) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_WARNING,
			  "failed to mmap shmem %ld,0x%x - %s\n",
			  size, ps->mmap_flags, strerror(-error));
		return error;
	}

	error = mlock(mem, size);
	if (error) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_WARNING, "failed to mlock shmem - %s\n",
			  strerror(errno));
	}

	phys_size = sizeof(*phys) * pages;
	phys = malloc(phys_size);
	if (!phys) {
		metal_unmap(mem, size);
		return -ENOMEM;
	}

	io = malloc(sizeof(*io));
	if (!io) {
		free(phys);
		metal_unmap(mem, size);
		return -ENOMEM;
	}

	if (_metal.pagemap_fd < 0) {
		phys[0] = 0;
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_WARNING,
		"shmem - failed to get va2pa mapping. use offset as pa.\n");
		metal_io_init(io, mem, phys, size, -1, 0, &metal_shmem_io_ops);
	} else {
		for (virt = mem, page = 0; page < pages; page++) {
			size_t offset = page * ps->page_size;

			error = metal_virt2phys(virt + offset, &phys[page]);
			if (error < 0)
				phys[page] = METAL_BAD_OFFSET;
		}
		metal_io_init(io, mem, phys, size, ps->page_shift, 0,
			&metal_shmem_io_ops);
	}
	*result = io;

	return 0;
}
```

scenario: No violation. The controlling expressions are not invariant: '_metal.pagemap_fd < 0' depends on a variable value and 'page < pages' depends on the loop index which changes each iteration. (A violating scenario would be a compile-time constant condition such as 'if (1)' or a for-loop with an invariant condition that never changes.)
